Dear Freedom of Information Officer,
I am writing to make a request for information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.
I would like to request the following information:
The names of all banking providers that this institution has used in the past two financial years (1st April 2022 – 1st April 2024).
The services that were used from the above banking providers in the past two financial years (1st April 2022 – 1st April 2024).
Banking provider refers to: an institution that deals in money and its substitutes which provides money-related services including but not limited to accepting deposits, making loans and providing credit card services.
Please provide the requested information in the order listed above. If the cost of complying with this request exceeds the appropriate limit as stated in section 12 of the Freedom of Information Act, please respond with as much information as possible within the limit, following the order of priority I have specified.
If any of this information is already publicly available, please provide a link or reference to where I can find it.
If you need any clarification or have any questions about my request, please don't hesitate to contact me. I would prefer to receive the information electronically, if possible.
Thank you for your assistance with this request. I look forward to your response within the statutory 20 working days.
Yours faithfully,
Monika Nielsen

Dear Monika Nielsen,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Banking which we
received on 15/08/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Sheffield City Council has banked with Barclays Bank for the entire period
in question.
Services used are fairly limited, in this period we have used:
• One 95-day notice deposit account with them.
• An interest earning overnight deposit account.
• Several current accounts relating to different income and expenditure
types, (e.g. general account, rents account etc).
• Overdraft facility (not used)
• Credit cards
• Various payment facilities e.g. emergency BACs payments
• Barclays BMAP account service – we have a team using Barclays to
manage Virtual accounts for individuals who are vulnerable and can no
longer manage their own accounts.
The council keeps its banking arrangements under review and cancels
services or facilities that are not providing value for money.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
